\
A Hand-Book for Engravers\

"ABOUT ENGRAVING\
\
Before even writing, there was engraving. Primitive peoples incised their earliest writings on stone and clay; long before the invention of pen and ink, the etching of knowledge on durable materials allowed the decoration of items, and the transmission of information. Engravers can apply symbols and decorations to most common metal objects, including most types of jewelry and weapons. Over seventy unique symbols are known to the castle's engravers currently; as an engraver's skill grows, he or she will be able to correctly depict more and more of these symbols."

"RELATED CRAFTS\
\
Not all items will succumb to the engraver's awl. Clothing items require the services of an EMBROIDERER; stationery is the specialty of the EMBOSSER; and bodily adornment is the province of the TATOOIST. Engravers are encouraged to acquire skill in one or more of these crafts as well."

"MEASURES OF PROFICIENCY\
\
Ten levels of proficiency are recognized for the engraver's skill:\
\
1. Novice\
2. Junior Apprentice\
3. Senior Apprentice\
4. Fellowcraft\
5. Journeyman\
6. Artisan\
7. Senior Artisan\
8. Master\
9. Master Adept\
10. Grand Master\
\
A Novice engraver possesses very limited ability, and is able to attempt only a few rudimentary symbols. As skill increases, however, many more possibilities become available. A seasoned Master may command dozens of decorative options.\
\
The following chapters describe the symbols available to engravers at each level of proficiency."

"NOVICE\
\
Novices are the least experienced engravers. Their decorative efforts are admittedly rather plain and utilitarian.\
\
They might etch items with the dot, line, mark, squiggle, smileyface, or the potato."

"JUNIOR APPRENTICE\
\
Junior Apprentices know a bit more than Novices, but their effects can hardly be called impressive.\
\
Items they incise might bear the square, circle, triangle, heart, star, moon, sun, key, leaf, or eye."

"SENIOR APPRENTICE\
\
Senior Apprentices have attained sufficient skill to depict a handful of modest but attractive symbols.\
\
They may grave the flower, dove, owl, duck, fish, hare, ermine, cat, rat, boat, kite, chair, plume, or rose."

"FELLOWCRAFT\
\
Fellowcraft engravers have spent many hours learning their trade, and may apply a personal mark onto items etched by their skill.\
\
Symbols they carve include the clef, quill, mask, thistle, anchor, tankard, hourglass, tree, needle, plow, scroll, paintbrush, and crow."

"JOURNEYMAN\
\
Journeymen possess the confidence to work with symbols of unique appeal and significance.\
\
They might chisel the sword, hammer, fist, skull, thunderbolt, serpent, dagger, scythe, or raven onto items."

"ARTISAN\
\
Artisans have proven themselves capable of the fine control needed to produce some of the more challenging and beautiful symbols.\
\
These attractive etchings include the walrus, monkey, boar, stag, lion, bull, bear, eagle, wolf, horse, fox, and swan."

"SENIOR ARTISAN\
\
Senior Artisans are sought by those desiring rare and exotic symbols for their possessions. They often serve as assistants to Master engravers.\
\
The Senior Artisans can produce items engraved with the trefoil, quatrefoil, cinquefoil, caduceus, lyre, compass, palette, spinningwheel, loom, or rose-vine."

"MASTER\
\
Masters are the virtuosi of the Engraver's art. Their long career of study and craftsmanship has earned them the ability to work with complex symbols requiring great skill to execute. They can also re-engrave over symbols that have already been produced.\
\
Their command of the art extends to depiction of the gryphon, unicorn, wyvern, phoenix, manticore, and basilisk.\
\
Additionally, Master Engravers are able to INSCRIBE initials, words and even complete phrases onto suitable items, and to remove these inscriptions if necessary. Inscriptions may exist alongside a previously engraved symbol."

"MASTER ADEPT\
\
Master Adepts represent the usual peak of achievement within the castle. Their work is often reserved for the members of the Queen's court. They can produce symbols of exceptional difficulty and depth of meaning.\
\
These symbols are the dragon and the castle."

"GRAND MASTER\
\
Many seasons may pass between the appearances of Grand Master engravers within the castle. Their efforts are almost exclusively for the Queen and other high nobles..\
\
They, and only they, can incise the triflame or snowflake onto objects."

"ABUSE OF THE CRAFT\
\
Engravers should avoid employing their art when the appearance of engraved symbols might imply a relationship which does not exist, or authority which has not been granted. The Queen's Capitulary specifies harsh punishments for forgery, impersonation of Her Majesty's officers, and false personation."

"UPDATES\
\
As fashion changes, and new styles are introduced, new symbols are created. The text of this book will mysteriously update itself as new choices become available. More advanced engravers will inform you if and when updates occur.\
\
Please bring typographical errors or other textual problems found in this volume to the attention of the staff."
